meanings.definition: The diameter of a bullet or other projectile.
meanings.sent1: The calibres of the bullets used in the shooting range vary in size.
meanings.sent2: The police officer checked the calibres of the ammunition found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The detective joked that the suspect must have mixed up the calibres and used the wrong bullets.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had the calibres of a sharpshooter, always hitting the target.
meanings.sent5: The calibres of the cannonballs were so large that they could cause significant damage.

meanings.definition: The quality or standard of someone's ability or character.
meanings.sent1: His calibres as a leader were evident in the way he handled difficult situations.
meanings.sent2: The calibres of honesty and integrity are essential in building trust.
meanings.sent3: Even in the face of adversity, her calibres of resilience shone through.
meanings.sent4: The calibres of her kindness were like a beacon of light in a dark world.
meanings.sent5: His calibres of creativity knew no bounds, always coming up with innovative solutions.
